item.title: RPPA Commercial Recreation Concessions Pilot Program Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
RPPA Commercial Recreation Concessions Pilot Program Act of 2019

This bill directs the Department of the Interior to establish a pilot program that authorizes commercial recreation concessions on land patented or leased under the Recreation and Public Purposes Act.

Interior shall enter into at most 10 agreements with parties to whom such land has been patented or leased for the establishment of these concessions.

A party to such an agreement may enter into agreements with third parties to establish such concessions.

bill.title: RPPA Commercial Recreation Concessions Pilot Program Act of 2019

item.title: RPPA Commercial Recreation Concessions Pilot Program Act of 2019
RPPA Commercial Recreation Concessions Pilot Program Act of 2019
A bill to require the Secretary of the Interior to establish a pilot program for commercial recreation concessions on certain land managed by the Bureau of Land Management.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
